comment.author: 74659969@N03
comment._content: Just a suggestion here...The lady beside Sean T. O'Kelly could be Mary McSwiney...I know this'll sound ridiculous, but she has a small distance between upper lip and nose...compare with this photo... catalogue.nli.ie/Record/vtls000030127

comment.author: 54082333@N00
comment._content: I dragged out my copy of a book called "The Irish Civil War" by Tim Pat Coogan & George Morrison, it's basically a photo book with some text explaining each photo. www.amazon.com/Irish-Civil-War-Tim-Coogan/dp/1841880205 On Page 135 there are 2 more photos from this photo call. It says the photos were taken on the steps of the National University on 10th January 1922. The text says it happened on the day the Dail voted for Arthur Griffith as President of the Dail to replace deValera. I'll add some IDs based on what this book says.

comment.author: 74659969@N03
comment._content: I was thinking that we should have a fair stab at identifying the six women in the photo... If the info on this vid is to be believed, the woman beside Liam Mellows in the photo is Countess Markievicz. www.youtube.com/watch?v=wR8Ex7Ln_fo&feature=related It seemed to be agreed that the lady with the white hair beside Dev is Margaret Pearse. theirishrising.blogspot.com/2010/10/members-of-second-dai... I agree with decsramble, the lady with the handkerchief to her face beside Dev looks like Kathleen Clarke. I made a suggestion about Mary MacSwiney earlier, but I agree; it's almost impossible to give a definitive id. I've found a few photos of some other Anti-Treaty TD ladies. Dr. Kathleen Lynn... loopline.com/kathleenlynn Dr. Ada English (lost her seat in the '22 election)... adaenglishsymposium.wordpress.com/2011/04/11/article-on-t... Kathleen O'Callaghan (small picture of her on her entry on this list) www.oireachtas.ie/members-hist/default.asp?housetype=0&am... Caitlín Brugha; www.waterfordmuseum.ie/exhibit/web/DisplayPrintableImage/... It's going to be tough to identify them though... EDIT: Mrs. Brugha probably wasn't there...she seems to have only entered politics following Cathal's death.

comment.author: 92695422@N03
comment._content: 7 January 1922 - Dail approves Anglo-Irish Treaty 9 January 1922 - De Valera dissolves govt, resigns Presidency in the Dail. 16 January 1922 - Handover to Collins of The Free State My great-grandfather, Erskine Childers, had left Dublin ( only to return once captured in Nov 1922) for Cobh. From the killing of Capt Wilson, a price was on his head, and other members of Dev's cabinet. He went to Cobh to continue printing An Poblacht, right after the Four courts . Therefore, as some have said, this photo could not be later than the spring of 1922. Those pictured are all Anti-Treaty. This is also filmed below by British Pathe, their film stock dating it as 16 January 1922. (Look at Brugha...same leather coat, and the building behind them is the same as the photos; most probably across the street from the Dail) www.britishpathe.com/video/the-outgoing-president/query/i... I would therefore say that these set of three photo's by Horgan, are between 7 -16 January 1922.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92695422@N03] Excellent background information! Thank you very much...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
